snippet: New York City’s new policy, which will include counseling and medicine, is intended as an alternative to solitary confinement and aims to address the increase in such prisoners.
abstract: New York City Corrections Dept is adopting new policy to treat mentally ill inmates with counseling and medicine, creating alternatives to more traditional approach of solitary confinement used for such prisoners.
lead_paragraph: New York City’s new policy, which will include counseling and medicine, is intended as an alternative to solitary confinement and aims to address the increase in such prisoners.

headline.seo: A New Approach to Disciplining Mentally Ill Inmates
headline.main: City Plans New Approach to Disciplining Mentally Ill Inmates
headline.print_headline: Jails to Treat, Not Just Isolate, Mentally Ill Inmates Who Break Rules
